clues.text: In 1849 the last issue of a newspaper Karl edited wasn't black & white, but this all over; he defiantly used that color ink
Karl looked forward to a "dictatorship of" this group, originally a word & a class from ancient Rome
Marx' grave bears a line from "The Communist Manifesto": "Workers of all lands", do this
Marx wrote that this "is money."  This "is commodities" & had a lot more to say about it, the title of his longest work
Marx considered religion "the opium of the people", which wouldn't have pleased his paternal grandfather, who had this job
The tertiary parrot that you listened to
clues.response: third bird heard (heard third bird accepted)

clues.text: Extreme happiness at the home of the Slurpee
To practice saying over & over again the magic hex that will affect a handbag
A lazy, careless attempt to break into your PC files
A horse liberated from Stockholm
Your first year will doubtless include a course or 2 on these legally enforceable agreements & their breaches
Law school students might participate in this "court", a hypothetical appellate case whose topic is chosen from a real case
Be forewarned--many of your profs will teach via this "method" named for a guy who lost his biggest trial
You'll need a class on these private wrongs like negligence & defamation
To take your case all the way to the Supreme Court, the main method is to ask the justices to grant a writ of this Latin word
"When life gives you lemons..."
"I came, I saw, ..."

A legal principle:
"Ignorance of the law is..."

Among AFI's 100 Greatest Movie Quotes of All Time:
"E.T. ..."

A principle often attributed to Hippocrates & followed by doctors:
"First do..."
In a David Hazan graphic novel, the Sheriff of Nottingham is after a serial killer & terrorists lurk in this forest
Anchee Min's "Wild Ginger" is set against the backdrop of this revolution launched by Mao in his final years
A tale of immigrants from Africa is Imbolo Mbue's "Behold" these people, also a term for DACA recipients
In "The Code Breaker" we learn of Jennifer Doudna & her work on this gene-editing technology
The title character in this Paulo Coelho novel turns lead into gold for young Santiago
This leading city of Northern Ireland is home to Queen's University
It's the only country that borders Venezuela & Ecuador
It's the name of the capital of Alberta, Canada & also of a northern suburb of London
In 2019 Astana, capital of this "stan", was renamed Nur-Sultan after retiring leader Nursultan Nazarbayev
Meaning "west" in Arabic, this term is used for the region that includes most of Africa North of the Sahara
A flapping of an insect's wings, or your eyelashes
You probably wear "safety" ones in chem lab
This type of chocolate has a set of double consonants & double vowels
Enriching a treasury is "filling" these, with the same derivation as a place to put the dead
The art of training a horse in precise movements, perhaps to prepare for a competition
Ewan McGregor plays a grown-up Danny Torrance in "Doctor Sleep", the sequel to this 1980 classic
This Simon Pegg horror comedy puns on the title of a George Romero flick
Stephen Lang played a character simply known as "The Blind Man" in this 2016 film & returned for its 2021 sequel
"Drag Me to Hell" is a spine-tingling entry from this director of "The Evil Dead" & "Spider-Man"
Ari Aster followed up "Hereditary" with this "seasonal" tale of a trip to a Swedish festival that goes horribly awry
The title femme of this Flaubert novel is married to a country doctor named Charles
In this novel, a flight surgeon named Doc Daneeka explains a paradoxical Army regulation about grounding fliers to Yossarian
Dr. Bernard Rieux treats the first victim of the title disease in this Camus novel
This Steinbeck work that's set in Monterey is dedicated to Ed Ricketts, on whom the character of Doc is partly based
"En Folkefiende" is the original title of this Ibsen play in which Dr. Stockmann tries to alert a town to its contaminated water
He used 2 hammers to bore a 14-foot hole in rock & defeat a drill; however, he died doing it
Some teach that the ghost of this pirate who died in 1718 glows under the waters off North Carolina, searching for his own head
He was big, he was blue & one story said his footprints filled with water & became Minnesota's 10,000 lakes, so to repeat... he was big
"Stand in front of the bathroom mirror with a... candle & say" this witch's name "3 times"; if it works, you'll need that drink, too
Were you raised by coyotes?! Well, this cowboy was, after being lost by his parents near a certain Texas river
The USS Pennsylvania was in drydock at this naval base on December 7, 1941
John Quincy Adams argued the case of the Africans who had mutinied aboard this slave ship & won their freedom
Tamil words for tie & wood give us the name of this type of twin-hulled boat
These boats in the lagoon at Boston's Public Garden were inspired by the opera "Lohengrin" & declared a Boston landmark
The world's first nuclear-powered aircraft carrier, it was launched in 1960 & was the 8th U.S. naval vessel to carry the name

rounds.category: I'M TOO SEXY: A LYRICAL POTPOURRI

clues.text: ... for my this, be it t-, guayabera or flannel; so sexy it hurts
...for your this, which we can only assume is a choice of Know-Nothing, Likud or Bull Moose
... for this northern Italian city & fashion capital, site of Sforzesco Castle
... for this animal "Who Walks Through Walls" in a Robert A. Heinlein title
... for this island nation whose largest freshwater lake is the 260-square-mile Biwa

rounds.text: In 1935 this country officially changed its name to one that means "Land of the Aryans"
